themes: Expanding creative freedom in public and commercial spaces
Reducing reliance on direct funding and grants
key_phrases: enable artists/designers/general citizens to express themselves through their environment
creative ways for that expression to be enabled through policy
not just on direct funding for specific artists and projects
advocate for or bring about new rules that give retailers & venues…etc. more creative freedom in their signage
opportunities for art installations in everyday objects, like community mailboxes
greater permissiveness for stores/venues/civic buildings to spill out onto the sidewalk or street
more holistic approach to enabling the public to beautify the public realm
without needing to ask for permission or apply for a grant and receive money from a limited pot of funds
barriers_identified: Requirement to ask for permission or apply for a grant
Limited pot of funds for direct funding
Restrictive rules on signage and use of public/commercial space
solutions_proposed: Enable creative expression through policy changes
Advocate for new rules allowing more creative freedom in signage
Allow art installations in everyday objects like community mailboxes
Increase permissiveness for stores/venues/civic buildings to use sidewalks or streets for creative purposes
Adopt a holistic approach to public beautification that does not rely solely on grants
